vanessa auraphin

  • github
  • twitter

interested in software studies, philosophy of information, complex systems, art.

currently, i work at a Singaporean govt agency dealing with thought leadership and policy directions for human and machine collaboration systems.

other times, i'm in charge of marketing & partnerships at CodingGirls SG.

this blog is intended to host what i call my 'writing snippets' - little blocks of writings on topics i find illumining. a lot of it will center on human and machine collaboration, offering insights from the humanities/cultural studies/media studies. i will also be posting summaries of publications here. overtime these writings will make up a palette of thoughts - of lite.

feel free to connect with me at vanessaauraphin@gmail.com.

What is materiality in AI Ethics?

January 26, 2020 vanessa auraphin

today, i write about the discourse around “materiality” of AI - it unwittingly interlocking with its counterpart in the philosphical tradition.

Some obvious questions are:

  • How do we constitute harm - does harm only need to be material to be legitimate?
  • What about trauma in its abstraction, its rhizomatic form?

I will unravel how interesting this intersection is - the discourse


-vanessa
